intro: Mariscus hillebrandii subsp. decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive mariscus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
